meanings.definition: Resembling a column in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The columnal building stood tall and straight, just like a pillar.
meanings.sent2: The row of columnal trees lined the path beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The columnal cake layers were perfectly stacked, looking like a tower.
meanings.sent4: Her columnal hair cascaded down her back like a waterfall of silk.
meanings.sent5: The columnal mountains rose majestically against the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The columnal shelves in the library held rows of books neatly.
meanings.sent2: The columnal architecture of the museum gave it a grand appearance.
meanings.sent3: The columnal rows of ants marched in perfect order across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The columnal pattern of lights on the stage created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The columnal arrangement of chairs made the room feel organized and spacious.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of a column.
meanings.sent1: The columnal design of the monument paid homage to ancient architecture.
meanings.sent2: The columnal details on the building added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The columnal patterns on the fabric gave it a regal look.
meanings.sent4: Her columnal speech echoed the eloquence of a seasoned orator.
meanings.sent5: The columnal structure of the organization ensured smooth communication channels.
